notes: Flagship luxury sedan with standard or long-wheelbase variants. Complex air suspension and electronic systems require specialized diagnostic equipment. AWD models feature slightly detuned engine output. Data sourced from Wikipedia Lexus LS article, January 2025 revision.

Flagship hybrid sedan exclusively in long-wheelbase configuration. High-voltage hybrid system requires certified technicians. Complex all-wheel drive hybrid powertrain with advanced electronics. Lithium-ion battery system demands specialized tools for service. Data sourced from Wikipedia Lexus LS article, January 2025 revision.

Fifth-generation LS featuring twin-turbocharged V6 replacing previous V8. Complex turbocharger system and advanced electronics require specialized diagnostic equipment. Data sourced from Wikipedia Lexus LS article, January 2025 revision.

Flagship hybrid sedan with Multi Stage Hybrid System combining traditional automatic gearbox with hybrid CVT. High-voltage lithium-ion battery system requires certified technicians. Advanced electronics and hybrid powertrain demand specialized diagnostic tools. Data sourced from Wikipedia Lexus LS article, January 2025 revision.

Sixth-generation ES sedan. Entry-level Lexus sedan with straightforward service requirements. Manufactured in Japan and Kentucky, USA from 2015. Data sourced from Wikipedia Lexus ES article, January 2025 revision.

Hybrid variant of sixth-generation ES. High-voltage hybrid system requires certified technicians for battery and electrical work. eCVT transmission needs specialized knowledge for diagnosis and repair. Data sourced from Wikipedia Lexus ES article, January 2025 revision.
Seventh-generation ES sedan with updated powertrain. Straightforward service requirements typical of modern Lexus vehicles. Data sourced from Wikipedia Lexus ES article, January 2025 revision.

Seventh-generation hybrid ES. High-voltage hybrid system requires certified technicians for battery and electrical work. eCVT transmission demands specialized diagnostic equipment. Data sourced from Wikipedia Lexus ES article, January 2025 revision.

Fourth-generation GS sports sedan. Rear-wheel drive platform with available all-wheel drive. Standard service complexity for modern Lexus vehicles. Data sourced from Wikipedia Lexus GS article, January 2025 revision.

Updated fourth-generation GS with increased output. Rear-wheel drive platform with available all-wheel drive. Standard service complexity. Data sourced from Wikipedia Lexus GS article, January 2025 revision.

Turbocharged four-cylinder variant introduced 2016. Renamed from GS 200t to GS 300 during production. Turbocharger service requires specialized knowledge. Data sourced from Wikipedia Lexus GS article, January 2025 revision.

Hybrid performance sedan with high-voltage system requiring certified technicians. CVT transmission integrated with hybrid system demands specialized diagnostic equipment. Data sourced from Wikipedia Lexus GS article, January 2025 revision.

High-performance variant with naturally aspirated V8. Performance-oriented suspension and braking systems require specialized knowledge for service. Data sourced from Wikipedia Lexus GS article, January 2025 revision.
Second-generation IS compact sports sedan. Standard service requirements for modern Lexus vehicles. Data sourced from Wikipedia Lexus IS article, January 2025 revision.
Convertible variant with retractable hardtop. Complex roof mechanism requires specialized knowledge for diagnosis and repair. Data sourced from Wikipedia Lexus IS article, January 2025 revision.
Performance variant of second-generation IS. Standard service requirements for modern Lexus vehicles. Data sourced from Wikipedia Lexus IS article, January 2025 revision.
Performance convertible with retractable hardtop. Complex roof mechanism requires specialized knowledge for diagnosis and repair. Data sourced from Wikipedia Lexus IS article, January 2025 revision.

High-performance variant with naturally aspirated V8. Performance-oriented suspension, braking, and differential systems require specialized knowledge. Data sourced from Wikipedia Lexus IS article, January 2025 revision.
Third-generation IS compact sports sedan. Standard service requirements for modern Lexus vehicles. Data sourced from Wikipedia Lexus IS article, January 2025 revision.
Turbocharged four-cylinder variant. Renamed to IS 300 in 2017. Turbocharger service requires specialized knowledge. Data sourced from Wikipedia Lexus IS article, January 2025 revision.

IS 300 nameplate applied to both turbocharged four-cylinder (RWD) and naturally aspirated V6 (AWD) variants starting 2017. Turbo models require specialized service knowledge. Data sourced from Wikipedia Lexus IS article, January 2025 revision.
Performance variant of third-generation IS. Standard service requirements for modern Lexus vehicles. Data sourced from Wikipedia Lexus IS article, January 2025 revision.

Turbocharged coupe variant based on IS platform. Renamed from RC 200t to RC 300 during production. Turbocharger service requires specialized knowledge. Data sourced from Wikipedia Lexus RC article, January 2025 revision.

Performance coupe based on IS platform. Different transmission depending on drivetrain configuration. Standard service requirements. Data sourced from Wikipedia Lexus RC article, January 2025 revision.

engines: 2.5L I4 Hybrid (176 hp gasoline + 105 kW electric motor)
notes: Hybrid coupe variant with high-voltage system requiring certified technicians. CVT transmission integrated with hybrid system demands specialized diagnostic equipment. Data sourced from Wikipedia Lexus RC article, January 2025 revision.

High-performance coupe with naturally aspirated V8. Performance-oriented suspension, braking, and limited-slip differential require specialized knowledge. Data sourced from Wikipedia Lexus RC article, January 2025 revision.

Flagship luxury coupe on TNGA GA-L platform. Complex electronics and performance-oriented systems require specialized diagnostic equipment. Data sourced from Wikipedia Lexus LC article, January 2025 revision.

engines: 3.5L V6 Hybrid (354 hp combined: 295 hp gasoline + 177 hp electric)
notes: Flagship hybrid coupe with advanced Multi Stage Hybrid System combining CVT with automatic transmission. High-voltage system requires certified technicians. Complex hybrid powertrain and electronics demand specialized diagnostic tools. Data sourced from Wikipedia Lexus LC article, January 2025 revision.
Third-generation RX luxury crossover SUV. Standard service requirements for modern Lexus vehicles. Data sourced from Wikipedia Lexus RX article, January 2025 revision.

Hybrid luxury crossover with high-voltage system requiring certified technicians. CVT transmission integrated with hybrid system demands specialized diagnostic equipment. Data sourced from Wikipedia Lexus RX article, January 2025 revision.

Turbocharged four-cylinder variant introduced 2016. Renamed from RX 200t to RX 300 during production. Turbocharger service requires specialized knowledge. Data sourced from Wikipedia Lexus RX article, January 2025 revision.
Fourth-generation RX with standard and extended-length variants. RX L features third-row seating. Standard service requirements. Data sourced from Wikipedia Lexus RX article, January 2025 revision.

Fourth-generation hybrid RX with standard and extended-length variants. High-voltage hybrid system requires certified technicians. eCVT transmission demands specialized diagnostic equipment. Data sourced from Wikipedia Lexus RX article, January 2025 revision.

Compact luxury crossover sharing platform with Toyota RAV4. Renamed from NX 200t to NX 300 after 2017 facelift. Turbocharger service requires specialized knowledge. Data sourced from Wikipedia Lexus NX article, January 2025 revision.

Hybrid compact crossover with high-voltage system requiring certified technicians. CVT transmission integrated with hybrid system demands specialized diagnostic equipment. Data sourced from Wikipedia Lexus NX article, January 2025 revision.

Body-on-frame luxury SUV based on Toyota Land Cruiser Prado. Features full-time four-wheel drive with Torsen center differential, Kinetic Dynamic Suspension System (KDSS), and advanced off-road systems including Crawl Control and A-TRAC. Complex suspension and 4WD systems require specialized knowledge. Data sourced from Wikipedia Lexus GX article, January 2025 revision.

Body-on-frame full-size luxury SUV based on Toyota Land Cruiser. Features Torsen center differential, Adjustable Height Control (AHC) suspension, and advanced off-road systems. Complex suspension and 4WD systems require specialized knowledge. Data sourced from Wikipedia Lexus LX article, January 2025 revision.

Updated LX 570 with 8-speed automatic transmission from 2015 model year. Body-on-frame construction with Torsen center differential and Adjustable Height Control suspension. Complex suspension and 4WD systems require specialized knowledge. Data sourced from Wikipedia Lexus LX article, January 2025 revision.

engines: 1.8L I4 Hybrid (134 hp combined: 98 hp gasoline + 80 hp electric)
notes: First luxury compact hybrid hatchback. Exclusively hybrid model with high-voltage system requiring certified technicians. eCVT transmission integrated with hybrid system demands specialized diagnostic equipment. Discontinued in US market May 2017. Data sourced from Wikipedia Lexus CT article, January 2025 revision.

engines: 2.4L I4 Hybrid (187 hp combined: 147 hp gasoline)
notes: First dedicated hybrid vehicle in Lexus lineup. Compact executive sedan exclusively available as hybrid. High-voltage system requires certified technicians. eCVT transmission demands specialized diagnostic equipment. Discontinued in US market 2012. Data sourced from Wikipedia Lexus HS article, January 2025 revision.
